intro: Phlomoides fetisowii, commonly known as the Tenerife phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
